Here Paul again met Timothy, who had witnessed his sufferings at the close of his first visit to Lystra and upon whose mind the impression then made had deepened with the passing of time until he was convinced that it was his duty to give himself fully to the work of the ministry. His 
                                                                           203
heart was knit with the heart of Paul, and he longed to share the apostle's labors by assisting as the way might open.
